title: Spicy Indian Green Beans, Gujarati Style Recipe
description: These Indian green beans with chile pepper, mustard, and garlic are cooked Gujarati-style, with a distinctive sweet, salty, and spicy flavors all at once.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Green Beans Spicy Indian Green Beans, Gujarati Style 4.4 (93) 72 Reviews 11 Photos These Gujarati-style Indian green beans deliver sweet, salty, and spicy flavors in every bite. Submitted by CEESHOUSE Updated on November 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1 inch pieces ¼ cup vegetable oil 4 cloves garlic, finely chopped 1 tablespoon black mustard seed 1 dried red chile pepper, crushed 1 teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon white sugar ground black pepper to taste Directions Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook green beans briefly in the boiling water, removing after 3 to 4 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain again. Blot dry. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in garlic and mustard seed; sauté until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in chile pepper, then add beans, salt, and sugar. Cook and stir until beans are tender, about 8 minutes. Season with pepper to serve. I Made It Print 118 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 171 Calories 14g Fat 11g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 171 % Daily Value * Total Fat 14g 18% Saturated Fat 2g 11% Sodium 589mg 26% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 5g 17% Total Sugars 2g Protein 3g 6% Vitamin C 20mg 22% Calcium 60mg 5% Iron 2mg 8% Potassium 255mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Spicy Indian Green Beans, Gujarati Style 01 of 11 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 11 Photo by  James 01/18/2021 03 of 11 Photo by  James 01/18/2021 04 of 11 Photo by  Scott Moffat 09/20/2017 05 of 11 Photo by  merryam 01/19/2016 06 of 11 Photo by  ONIOND 07/19/2014 Very tasty! The only change I made was to use half a fresh hot pepper, instead of a dried one...I don't like a lot of spice :) The browned up garlic bits were delicious! I did think it turned out too oily, maybe less next time. Great way to use up the first batch of garden beans this year, thanks for sharing the recipe! 07 of 11 Photo by  user23890382908 07/06/2014 Who knew green beans could have so much flavor. I'm defiantly making this again! 08 of 11 Photo by  Molly 03/11/2014 A really good green bean recipe. And, I'm not a huge green bean fan. I did not have black mustard seed (nor have I ever heard of it) but the internet told me to sub horseradish for it. That was the only change I made to the recipe. This recipe has been in my recipe box for a very long time. I'm really glad I finally made, and I will be using this one again. 09 of 11 Photo by  ilikeitspicy 11/07/2010 I love these green beans! Although I did use a few sub items based on the reviews of others. I used prepared horseradish in place of the mustard seed, EVOO instead of the veg oil, and crushed chiles (the kind you put on pizza). I like to eat the leftovers cold, that is if there are any! Thanks for the recipe Ceeshouse and others! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Sweet and Spicy Green Beans 883 Ratings Creamy Green Beans Parmesan 52 Ratings Lemon Pepper Green Beans 382 Ratings Garlic Green Beans 1,265 Ratings Easy Garden Green Beans 143 Ratings Chinese Garlic Green Beans 397 Ratings Fried Green Beans 48 Ratings Sesame Green Beans 681 Ratings Ken Shoe Green Beans 32 Ratings Pan Fried Green Beans 103 Ratings Green Bean Curry 32 Ratings Green Beans for a Special Occasion 98 Ratings Green Beans with Almonds and Caramelized Shallots 136 Ratings Southern Green Beans 472 Ratings Chinese Green Bean Stir-Fry 91 Ratings Quick Sesame Green Beans 172 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: CEESHOUSE
instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook green beans briefly in the boiling water, removing after 3 to 4 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain again. Blot dry.;Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in garlic and mustard seed; sauté until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in chile pepper, then add beans, salt, and sugar. Cook and stir until beans are tender, about 8 minutes. Season with pepper to serve.
